id-00001.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
id-00001.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The kobold is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The kobold has the following spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produceflame, shillelagh 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds,fog cloud, healing word 2nd level (3 slots):flaming sphere, heat metal

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 -1) bludgeoning damage.

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond.If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00002.name: Armor of the Hive
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the armor sliver can't have AC less than 16.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The sliver makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:1 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

bonegolem.damageimmunities: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
bonegolem.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
bonegolem.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

id-00001.name: Immutable Form
id-00001.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.name: Magic Weapons
id-00003.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical. ACTION5

id-00004.name: Multiattack
id-00004.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

id-00005.name: Slam
id-00005.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

id-00006.name: Bone Prison
id-00006.desc: The golem targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. A prison of magical bones surrounds the creature. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained. The restrained creature can break free by succeeding on a DC 20 escape check, or by destroying the bone prison (AC 20; 50 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). The golem can only have one bone prison active at a time. It may dismiss the bone prison as a bonus action.

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond.If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00002.name: Resistance of the Hive
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the crystalline sliver have the Crystalline Skin feature.

id-00003.name: Crystalline Skin
id-00003.desc: The sliver has resistance to damage from spells and advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The sliver makes two daw attacks.

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

id-00002.name: Acidity of the Hive
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the spitting sliver can use the Acid Spray action.

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (Td8 + 3) slashing damage.

id-00003.desc: The sliver spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fallenangel.damageresistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Corrupted Weapons
id-00001.desc: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

id-00002.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good, 1/day each: death ward, harm,

id-00003.name: Magic Resistance
id-00003.desc: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00004.name: Shapechanger
id-00004.desc: The angel can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The angel makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Scimitar
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

id-00003.name: Vampiric Touch (3/day)
id-00003.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the angel regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

id-00001.name: False Appearance
id-00001.desc: While the lizard remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant, such as a colorful fern.

id-00001.name: Tail
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00002.name: Venemous Spittle (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: The lizard spits a glob of venom at a creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the lizard's next turn.

fusionelemental.name: FUSION ELEMENTAL
fusionelemental.damageimmunities: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
fusionelemental.conditionimmunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, unconscious

id-00001.name: Volatile Form
id-00001.desc: When the elemental dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage, 10 (3d6) lightning damage, 10 (3d6) fire damage, and 10 (3d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Multlattack
id-00001.desc: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 1 Oft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) damage of a type chosen randomly from the following: acid, lightning, fire, or cold.

id-00003.name: Hurl Energy
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) damage of a type chosen randomly from the following: acid, lightning, fire, or cold. Elemental Chaos (Recharge 5-6). The elemental makes one elemental chaos attack at random.

id-00004.desc: Earthquake. A seismic disturbance radiates from the elemental in a 100-foot radius circle. Each creature on the ground in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must also succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or break concentration. The area becomes difficult terrain after the earthquake.

id-00005.desc: Fire Breath. The elemental exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ( 12d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00006.desc: Tidal Wave. A massive wave emanates from the elemental. Each creature within 60 feet of the elemental must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 60 feet away from the elemental. On a success, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the elemental.

id-00007.desc: Whirlwind. The elemental summons a 10-foot-radius, 60-foot high whirlwind centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 27 (6d8) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 40 feet away in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

id-00001.desc: The elemental can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elemental regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Hurl Energy
id-00002.desc: The elemental uses its Hurl Energy.

id-00003.name: Harness Energy (Costs 2 actions)
id-00003.desc: The elemental regains use of its Elemental Chaos.

id-00004.name: Unstable Outburst (Costs 3 actions)
id-00004.desc: The elemental loses control of its chaotic energies. Each creature within 30 feet of the elemental, including the elemental itself, must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) damage of a type chosen randomly from the following: acid, lightning, fire, or cold. A creature takes half damage on a success. The elemental has no immunity to the damage caused by this outburst.

id-00001.name: Rampage
id-00001.desc: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

id-00002.name: Aura of Malice
id-00002.desc: All enemies within 10 feet of the gnoll have disadvantage on saving throws.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its greatsword.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:1 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

id-00003.name: Greatsword
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Rampage
id-00001.desc: When the hyena reduces a creature to0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the hyena can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

id-00001.name: Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The gnoll is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). id-00001.name: Dagger
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

id-00002.name: Conjure Fiends (1/Day)
id-00002.desc: The gnoll magically summons 1d4 fiendish hyenas. The summoned fiends appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of their summoner and act as allies of their summoner. They remain for 10 minutes, until they or their summoner dies, or until their summoner dismisses them as an action.

id-00001.name: Undead Fortitude
id-00001.desc: If damage reduces the grave titan to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the grave titan drops to 1 hit point instead.

id-00001.desc: The grave titan makes two greatsword attacks.

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (6d6 + 8) slashing damage.

id-00003.name: Hurl Zombies
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. After the attack hits or misses, 1d4 + 1 zombies arise adjacent to the target.

id-00001.desc: The leonin has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

id-00002.name: Keen Smell
id-00002.desc: The leonin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00003.name: Pounce
id-00003.desc: If the leonin moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the leonin can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (ld6 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Javelin
id-00003.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00001.desc: The kobold makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Sling
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

id-00004.name: Low Blow (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The kobold makes a cheap shot against a creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated until the end of the kobold's next turn.

id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.desc: The kobold makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00002.name: Scurry
id-00002.desc: The kobold moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

id-00003.name: Stabby
id-00003.desc: The kobold makes one melee weapon attack.

id-00004.name: Pocket Sand (Costs 2 actions)
id-00004.desc: The kobold throws sand at a creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the kobold's next turn.

id-00001.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
id-00001.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The kobold is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The kobold has the following spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produceflame, shillelagh 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds,fog cloud, healing word 2nd level (3 slots):flaming sphere, heat metal

id-00001.name: Club
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 -1) bludgeoning damage.

krakenhatchling.name: KRAKEN HATCHLING
krakenhatchling.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
krakenhatchling.languages: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, and Primordial but can't speak

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The kraken can breathe air and water.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 Oto hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns. If the kraken takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of t he kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

id-00003.name: Tentacle
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

id-00004.name: Fling
id-00004.desc: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

id-00005.name: Lightning Field (Recharge 5-6)
id-00005.desc: All creatures within 60 feet of the kraken must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Lightning Field (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn. Tentacle Attack or Fling. The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

id-00002.name: Release the Kraken (Costs 2 actions)
id-00002.desc: The kraken removes any magical effects on itself that reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained, and escapes from any nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

id-00003.name: Water Surge (Costs 3 actions)
id-00003.desc: A strong current surges from the kraken. Each creature within 30 feet of the kraken must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the kraken. On a success, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the kraken.

id-00001.name: Unarmored Defense
id-00001.desc: While the initiate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

id-00001.name: Block
id-00001.desc: The initiate adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the initiate must see the attacker.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The initiate makes two attacks: one with its unarmed strike and one with its fire jab.

id-00002.name: Unarmed Strike
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Fire jab
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

id-00004.name: Three Point Strike (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The initiate makes three unarmed strike attacks against one target. If two attacks hit, the target is incapacitated. If three attacks hit, the target is stunned. These conditions last until the end of the initiate's next turn.

text.p: Monks of the Five Spires

A swift jab sent a jolt of pain through Kine's body. He grimaced, imagining every bar fight he had ever been in. The figure before him crouched low, balancing lightly on a single foot as the other poised, ready to lash out. Kine felt the sore spot where the monk had punched him - it burned slightly. He hefted his hammer and prepared to strike. The area where the monk had punched him suddenly flared with pain, feeling as though a hot brand had been placed there. Kine doubled over, hammer falling from his hand as he realized his mistake. This was not a brawling fighter; his opponent was a Monk of the Five Spires.

Trained to hone their magical Ki into dangerous burning attacks, the Monks of the Five Spires are well known for their martial brilliance. Capable of both taking and returning devastating blows, a Monk of the Five Spires practices asceticism and monastic values with fanatic fervor.

Order of the Five. Unlike others who take the path of a monk, Monks of the Five Spires are extremely selective about those who are permitted to join their way of life. Believing in strict discipline, physical prowess and the acceptance of the volatile emotions that drive them, Monks of the Five Spires push their initiates close todeath, looking to ignite in them the spark of Ki that will give them their abilities.

Located near volcanoes, the Five Spires are formidable towers of stone and obsidian. Rising high into the air, these towers serve as a proving ground for Five Spire Initiates and homes to the Masters of the Five Spires. Monks of the Five Spires view themselves as artisans of battle. In the face of other monastic paths, a Monk of the Five Spires understands that they may be inferior but when it comes to a fight, there is none better. Trained to accept radical emotions, Monks of the Five Spires often come off as explosive and extreme. These ranges of emotions are the key source of energy that drives the Monks of the Five Spires. They use these fiery emotions to enhance their Ki energies, manifesting them into searing pain.

Initiation. With the desire to become a Monk of the Five Spires, initiates go to a small town known as Blackwrath. Nestled at the base of the Five Spires, initiates must climb up a tower to be accepted as an apprentice. Those who fall could not overcome the first challenge. Each day following, Initiates of the Five Spires must climb the tower. Here they train, work and follow their master's missives. Each evening, initiates climb back down and sleep in Blackwrath. Only masters may live at the top of the Five Spires.

Initiates of the Five Spires often are sent on missions to expand their view of the world and uphold law. During this time, Initiates of the Five Spires are required to return half of their earnings to the Spires as well as new discoveries. Those who fail to do this are either rejected from the path or punished upon return.

Those who survive eventually attempt to join their masters. In a dangerous trial, the initiate swallows a draught of living fire, harvested from the nearby volcanoes. Wracked with pain, the initiate fights one of their masters. If they land a single hit upon the master, they are accepted as a Master of the Five Spires.

id-00001.name: Unarmored Defense
id-00001.desc: While the master is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

id-00001.name: Fiery Block
id-00001.desc: The master adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the master must see the attacker. If the attack misses, the attacker takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The master makes three attacks: two with its unarmed strikes and one with its fire kick.

id-00002.name: Unarmed Strike
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Fire Kick
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Fury of the Five Spires (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The master makes five unarmed strike attacks against one target. The target must then make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw with a +1 DC for every attack that hit. On a failed save the target is knocked unconscious until the end of the master's next turn.

Nestled at the base of the Five Spires, initiates must climb up a tower to be accepted as an apprentice. Those who fall could not overcome the first challenge. Each day following, Initiates of the Five Spires must climb the tower. Here they train, work and follow their master's missives. Each evening, initiates climb back down and sleep in Blackwrath. Only masters may live at the top of the Five Spires.

Initiates of the Five Spires often are sent on missions to expand their view of the world and uphold law. During this time, Initiates of the Five Spires are required to return half of their earnings to the Spires as well as new discoveries. Those who fail to do this are either rejected from the path or punished upon return.

Those who survive eventually attempt to join their masters. In a dangerous trial, the initiate swallows a draught of living fire, harvested from the nearby volcanoes. Wracked with pain, the initiate fights one of their masters. If they land a single hit upon the master, they are accepted as a Master of the Five Spires.

text.p: Selachian

With the upper body of a shark and humanoid arms and legs, Selachians mark their bodies with scars, showing familial houses, honorable hunts or simply to make themselves more menacing. Selachian ruthlessness is well known among coastal and aquatic communities. Raiding parties wash like waves over sand castles, leaving destruction in their wake, before disappearing back into the sea.

Selachian Settlements. Most commonly found in the cold northern regions of the world, Selachian settlements are built in coral reefs, rocky coasts or underwater cliffs bordering a deep abyss. Unlike the rival merfolk, Selachians care little for the passage of time, often living for years without interaction with the outside world. Selachians tend to delve into the darkest parts of the ocean, hunting in packs to track down and kill larger prey. They come to the surface to raid ships and nearby settlements to collect more materials for their homes. Selachians defend themselves with weapons taken from pirating or crafted from whatever materials were salvaged from shipwrecks, beaches, and dead undersea creatures.

Hired Muscle. Often, pirating crews or desperate merchants will hire a pair of Selachians to work for them. Money does little to inspire a Selachian, but promise of fresh blood or an epic prize will keep a Selachian in check for a time. Bought more for their brawn than brain, Selachians find their place as bodyguards or thugs, their bulky forms not well suited for nimble work.

Pirates who convince these beasts to ship with them employ their strength as living grappling lines and frontline warriors. Sent to board the enemy ship first, Selachians fall into bloody frenzies, leaving behind a wake of destruction until either alone or killed.

Biggest Prize. Selachian communities believe in constantly outdoing one another. At birth, two Selachians are paired. For the rest of their lives, these Selachians wage a constant battle, heavily prompted by the community, to bring back the greatest prize. Often this prize is a kill or trophy but can also be feats of unlikely success. If a Selachian dies from this competition, their partner attempts to fulfill the pact for the other, marking it as the greatest prize they could achieve.

Mortal Enemies. Selachians and merf olk are mortal enemies. Years of raiding, destruction and war have carved a rift between the two species. Selachians also cannot abide merrow, who remind them too much of their less abyssal kin.

id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The kobold makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Rapier
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00001.name: Rapier
id-00001.desc: The kobold can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The kobold regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

id-00002.name: Scurry
id-00002.desc: The kobold moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

id-00003.name: Stabby
id-00003.desc: The kobold makes one melee weapon attack.

id-00004.name: Pocket Sand (Costs 2 actions)
id-00004.desc: The kobold throws sand at a creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the kobold's next turn.

id-00001.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
id-00001.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The kobold is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The kobold has the following spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produceflame, shillelagh 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds,fog cloud, healing word 2nd level (3 slots):flaming sphere, heat metal

id-00001.name: Club
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 -1) bludgeoning damage.

krakenhatchling.name: KRAKEN HATCHLING
krakenhatchling.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
krakenhatchling.languages: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, and Primordial but can't speak

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The kraken can breathe air and water.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 Oto hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns. If the kraken takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of t he kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

id-00003.name: Tentacle
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

id-00004.name: Fling
id-00004.desc: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

id-00005.name: Lightning Field (Recharge 5-6)
id-00005.desc: All creatures within 60 feet of the kraken must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Lightning Field (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn. Tentacle Attack or Fling. The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

id-00002.name: Release the Kraken (Costs 2 actions)
id-00002.desc: The kraken removes any magical effects on itself that reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained, and escapes from any nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

id-00003.name: Water Surge (Costs 3 actions)
id-00003.desc: A strong current surges from the kraken. Each creature within 30 feet of the kraken must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the kraken. On a success, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the kraken.

id-00001.name: Unarmored Defense
id-00001.desc: While the initiate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

id-00001.name: Block
id-00001.desc: The initiate adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the initiate must see the attacker.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The initiate makes two attacks: one with its unarmed strike and one with its fire jab.

id-00002.name: Unarmed Strike
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Fire jab
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

id-00004.name: Three Point Strike (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The initiate makes three unarmed strike attacks against one target. If two attacks hit, the target is incapacitated. If three attacks hit, the target is stunned. These conditions last until the end of the initiate's next turn.

text.p: Monks of the Five Spires

A swift jab sent a jolt of pain through Kine's body. He grimaced, imagining every bar fight he had ever been in. The figure before him crouched low, balancing lightly on a single foot as the other poised, ready to lash out. Kine felt the sore spot where the monk had punched him - it burned slightly. He hefted his hammer and prepared to strike. The area where the monk had punched him suddenly flared with pain, feeling as though a hot brand had been placed there. Kine doubled over, hammer falling from his hand as he realized his mistake. This was not a brawling fighter; his opponent was a Monk of the Five Spires.

Trained to hone their magical Ki into dangerous burning attacks, the Monks of the Five Spires are well known for their martial brilliance. Capable of both taking and returning devastating blows, a Monk of the Five Spires practices asceticism and monastic values with fanatic fervor.

Order of the Five. Unlike others who take the path of a monk, Monks of the Five Spires are extremely selective about those who are permitted to join their way of life. Believing in strict discipline, physical prowess and the acceptance of the volatile emotions that drive them, Monks of the Five Spires push their initiates close todeath, looking to ignite in them the spark of Ki that will give them their abilities.

Located near volcanoes, the Five Spires are formidable towers of stone and obsidian. Rising high into the air, these towers serve as a proving ground for Five Spire Initiates and homes to the Masters of the Five Spires. Monks of the Five Spires view themselves as artisans of battle. In the face of other monastic paths, a Monk of the Five Spires understands that they may be inferior but when it comes to a fight, there is none better. Trained to accept radical emotions, Monks of the Five Spires often come off as explosive and extreme. These ranges of emotions are the key source of energy that drives the Monks of the Five Spires. They use these fiery emotions to enhance their Ki energies, manifesting them into searing pain.

Initiation. With the desire to become a Monk of the Five Spires, initiates go to a small town known as Blackwrath. Nestled at the base of the Five Spires, initiates must climb up a tower to be accepted as an apprentice. Those who fall could not overcome the first challenge. Each day following, Initiates of the Five Spires must climb the tower. Here they train, work and follow their master's missives. Each evening, initiates climb back down and sleep in Blackwrath. Only masters may live at the top of the Five Spires.

Initiates of the Five Spires often are sent on missions to expand their view of the world and uphold law. During this time, Initiates of the Five Spires are required to return half of their earnings to the Spires as well as new discoveries. Those who fail to do this are either rejected from the path or punished upon return.

Those who survive eventually attempt to join their masters. In a dangerous trial, the initiate swallows a draught of living fire, harvested from the nearby volcanoes. Wracked with pain, the initiate fights one of their masters. If they land a single hit upon the master, they are accepted as a Master of the Five Spires.

id-00001.name: Unarmored Defense
id-00001.desc: While the master is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

id-00001.name: Fiery Block
id-00001.desc: The master adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the master must see the attacker. If the attack misses, the attacker takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The master makes three attacks: two with its unarmed strikes and one with its fire kick.

id-00002.name: Unarmed Strike
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Fire Kick
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Fury of the Five Spires (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The master makes five unarmed strike attacks against one target. The target must then make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw with a +1 DC for every attack that hit. On a failed save the target is knocked unconscious until the end of the master's next turn.

morphlit.name: MORPHLIT
morphlit.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Fiery Block
id-00001.desc: Shapechanger, The morphlit can use its bonus action to polymorph into a form with wings (speed 10 ft., fly 30 ft.) a form with fins (speed 10 ft., swim 30 ft.) or a form with digging claws (speed 30 ft., burrow 30 ft.), or back to its natural form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted.

id-00002.name: Defensive Adaptation
id-00002.desc: The morphlit can use its bonus action to gain immunity to any single damage type. The damage immunity remains until the morphlit uses this ability again. The morphlit also deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage of the chosen type when it hits with its bite attack.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The morphlit makes two bite attacks.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack;+6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) damage of the type chosen by its defensive adaptation ability.

myrbattlesphere.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
myrbattlesphere.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

id-00001.name: Disassemble
id-00001.desc: When the battlesphere dies, it splits into 2d4 myr.

id-00002.name: Reassemble
id-00002.desc: If the battlesphere moves through the space of an allied myr, it absorbs the myr and regains 7 (2d6) hit points.

id-00001.name: Crush
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 -t* 5) bludgeoning damage.

id-00002.name: Overrun (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: The battlesphere moves twice its speed and can move through the space of any creature that is Medium or smaller. Additionally, the battlesphere's movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks for the rest of the turn. When first entering a creature's space, the battlesphere can make a crush attack against that target. If the attack hits, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The priest is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, chill touch, poison spray, thaumaturgy 1st level (4 slots): bane, inflict wounds, ray of sickness 2nd level (3 slots): ray of enfeeblement, misty step, spider climb 3rd level (3 slots): stinking cloud, vampiric touch 4th level (3 slots): blight, confusion 5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague

id-00001.name: Claw
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage.

id-00002.name: Summon Demon (1/day)
id-00002.desc: The priest attempts to magically summon a Herald of Rot with a 40 percent chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons.It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

id-00001.name: Keen Smell
id-00001.desc: The rat hermit has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00002.name: Rat Telepathy
id-00002.desc: The rat hermit can magically command any rat within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

id-00003.name: Vermin Shield
id-00003.desc: Whenever the rat hermit is hit by an attack, as a reaction it can have an allied rat or swarm of rats within 5 feet become the target of the attack instead .

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The rat herm it makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Claws
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Call the Swarm (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The rat hermit magically calls a swarm of rats. The called creatures arrive in 1 round, acting as allies of the rat hermit and obeying its commands.

selachian.name: SELACHIAN
selachian.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (only in water), passive Perception 14

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The selachian can breathe air and water.

id-00002.name: Blood Frenzy
id-00002.desc: The selachian has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The selachian makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its harpoon.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Harpoon
id-00003.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the selachian or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the selachian.

text.p: Selachian

With the upper body of a shark and humanoid arms and legs, Selachians mark their bodies with scars, showing familial houses, honorable hunts or simply to make themselves more menacing. Selachian ruthlessness is well known among coastal and aquatic communities. Raiding parties wash like waves over sand castles, leaving destruction in their wake, before disappearing back into the sea.

Selachian Settlements. Most commonly found in the cold northern regions of the world, Selachian settlements are built in coral reefs, rocky coasts or underwater cliffs bordering a deep abyss. Unlike the rival merfolk, Selachians care little for the passage of time, often living for years without interaction with the outside world. Selachians tend to delve into the darkest parts of the ocean, hunting in packs to track down and kill larger prey. They come to the surface to raid ships and nearby settlements to collect more materials for their homes. Selachians defend themselves with weapons taken from pirating or crafted from whatever materials were salvaged from shipwrecks, beaches, and dead undersea creatures.

Hired Muscle. Often, pirating crews or desperate merchants will hire a pair of Selachians to work for them. Money does little to inspire a Selachian, but promise of fresh blood or an epic prize will keep a Selachian in check for a time. Bought more for their brawn than brain, Selachians find their place as bodyguards or thugs, their bulky forms not well suited for nimble work.

Pirates who convince these beasts to ship with them employ their strength as living grappling lines and frontline warriors. Sent to board the enemy ship first, Selachians fall into bloody frenzies, leaving behind a wake of destruction until either alone or killed.

Biggest Prize. Selachian communities believe in constantly outdoing one another. At birth, two Selachians are paired. For the rest of their lives, these Selachians wage a constant battle, heavily prompted by the community, to bring back the greatest prize. Often this prize is a kill or trophy but can also be feats of unlikely success. If a Selachian dies from this competition, their partner attempts to fulfill the pact for the other, marking it as the greatest prize they could achieve.

Mortal Enemies. Selachians and merf olk are mortal enemies. Years of raiding, destruction and war have carved a rift between the two species. Selachians also cannot abide merrow, who remind them too much of their less abyssal kin.

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond. If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The silver makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

sliverqueen.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
sliverqueen.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 18

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of the queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond. If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00002.name: Queen of the Hive
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the queen have immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions.

id-00003.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
id-00003.desc: If the queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The queen makes three attacks: one with her tail and two with her claws.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

id-00003.name: Tail
id-00003.desc: Me/ee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

id-00004.name: Forced Evolution (Recharge 6)
id-00004.desc: The queen targets a sliver t hat she can see within 120 feet of her. The target permanently t ransforms into a sliver creature of challenge rating 4 or lower. The target regains hit points up to its new maximum hit points.

id-00001.name: Forced Evolution (Recharge 6)
id-00001.desc: The queen can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

id-00002.name: Tail Attack
id-00002.desc: The queen makes a tail attack. Sliver Spawn (Costs 2 actions). The queen spawns a sliver of challenge rating 1 /2 that appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of her.

id-00003.name: Nurture the Hive (Costs 3 actions)
id-00003.desc: All slivers within 30 feet of the queen regain 12 (2d8 + 3) hit points.

spirit.name: SPIRIT
spirit.damageresistances: add, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
spirit.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
spirit.languages: any languages it knew in life

id-00001.name: Ethereal Sight
id-00001.desc: The spirit can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material plane, and vice versa.

id-00002.name: Incorporeal Movement
id-00002.desc: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

id-00001.name: Withering Touch
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

id-00002.name: Etherealness
id-00002.desc: The spirit enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.It is visible on the Materia! Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

id-00003.name: Scare (1/Day)
id-00003.desc: One creature of the spirit's choice within 20 feet of it must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the spirit is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.
